info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 18 at 3:28PM EDT until March 21 at 1:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield VA
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Virginia...
Nottoway River At Sebrell affecting Sussex and Southampton Counties.
For the Chowan Basin...including Sebrell...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Nottoway River at Sebrell.
* WHEN...From this afternoon to early Friday afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Water begins to cover Old Forty Road, State Route 634, in Sussex County. Additionally, Peters Bridge boat landing and portions of the Chub Sandhill Natural Area Preserve begin to flood, approximately 5 miles upstream of gage.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:15 PM EDT Tuesday the stage was 16.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 12.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:15 PM EDT Tuesday was 16.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 16.9 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Friday morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.0 feet on 02/12/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 900 AM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON
